condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.2: Legislation, policies and protocols (including respective accountabilities) related to VAC are aligned across health, education and justice systems, legally enforced and regularly monitored.

description.narrative: Kazakhstan has advanced policies related to preventing and addressing violence, abuse and neglect of children by developing guidelines for inter-agency collaboration and initiating sector-specific regulations. Legislation was adopted making mandatory reporting of cases of violence against children by health, education and social protection specialists. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2020

title.narrative: Country routinely collects and publishes key types of administrative data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children, disaggregated by age and sex.

baseline.value: Key types of administrative data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children, disaggregated by age and sex, are not collected by education, social and health sector, collected by police without full disaggregation

target.value: 2020:education, social protection, health and justice sectors establish the mechanisms for routine collection and publication of key types of administrative data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children, disaggregated by age and sex.

actual.value: 2019:Assessment of sources of administrative data on violence against children was agreed with national statistics offices (NSOs) and Ministry of Education of the RK and will be launched with data collection and analysis in 2020.

title.narrative: Quality of legal frameworks are in place to promote, enforce and monitor equality and non-discrimination for children, regardless of their migratory status

baseline.value: Quality of legal frameworks are not equity focused in relation to: child immigration detention care arrangements for refugee and migrant children guardianship system (for both migrant children and children left behind) access to health for all children affected by migration (both migrant and children left behind) inclusive education (for both migrant children and children left behind)

target.value: 2020:quality of legal frameworks are equity focused in relation to: ¿ child immigration detention ¿ care arrangements for refugee and migrant children

actual.value: 2019:Analysis of legislation on children affected by migration was launched. Draft law ensuring birth registration of children born to parents with undetermined status and Draft law concerning migrants' status was submitted to the Parliament of the RK.

title.narrative: Status of a legal and normative frameworks enabling reporting and referral (between sectors) of VAC cases

baseline.value: The current legal and normative framework does not fully enable reporting and referral between sectors

target.value: 2020:national authorities adopt a legal and normative framework enabling reporting, appropriate referral of cases of VAC across sectors, and resource enforcement of VAC-related legislation.

actual.value: 2019:MOES has developed Recommendations on Inter-Agency Coordination for Identification and Work with Cases of Child Abuse. However, the document is not mandatory for implementation. National Public Health Centre of MOH has developed and tested Standard Operating Procedure for Health Specialists on Ident
